title: PLEASE HELP RIOT!!!
body: I open my client and it says " There is a problem with your connection.If you are not currently connected to the internet, please do so. If you already are but cannot connect to League of Legends check our support page to find possible solutions..." So i did i couldn't find anything about what i'm dealing with and i'm clearly connected to the internet lol.. just wanna no how to fix it.. Now if i manage to log in everything is gray and the same msg comes up... I can't even msg in the mobile app either saying my not logged in..

replies.body:
Hey guys, apologies for the late response on this. We experienced a temporary connection issue that affected both the legacy and the updated client. The thing is that the updated client has better error messaging so errors / issues that are more cryptic in the legacy client may be super visible in the client update.

This issue should now be resolved.

Everyone is blaming the new client it looks like, but the legacy one isn't any better in my experience with this issue. I got the legacy one to launch. At the gray "Restart/Shutdown" screen I right clicked the icon on my taskbar, and clicked close. It prompted the "Are you sure you want to exit?" screen. I clicked no, and was at the login screen. Legacy client blames me. "Make sure your internet connection is enabled and your firewall isn't blocking it" and I can log in from the new client, but it wont let me click play at the top.
The message it gives really doesn't sit well with me. It sounds like they blame my internet, when apparently a lot of people are having the same issue. Really wish it was worded different I guess.

Anyone know what a "RADS Error" is?
Like I said to get this screen just try to close the new client, and say "No" when it asks if you want to close it. It should bypass the grey screen. Then select legacy launcher.
http://imgur.com/a/Fk9Zw
Don't know how relevant it is, but my IP count is still off what it should be. {{item:3070}}

"If you're running into issues launching the updated client:

Go to your League of Legends install folder. Default is (C:\Riot Games\League of Legends) go to \RADS\system
Locate the user.cfg file and open with notepad
Change leagueClientOptIn = yes to leagueClientOptIn = no
Save and go to your League install directory and run lol.launcher.exe"
